pc:dimension.pc:description: Representation of the pulse return magnitude
pc:dimension.pc:name: Intensity

pc:dimension.pc:description: Pulse return number for a given output pulse. A given output laser pulse can have many returns, and they must be marked in order, starting with 1
pc:dimension.pc:name: ReturnNumber

pc:dimension.pc:description: Total number of returns for a given pulse.
pc:dimension.pc:name: NumberOfReturns

pc:dimension.pc:description: Direction at which the scanner mirror was traveling at the time of the output pulse. A value of 1 is a positive scan direction, and a bit value of 0 is a negative scan direction, where positive scan direction is a scan moving from the left side of the in-track direction to the right side and negative the opposite
pc:dimension.pc:name: ScanDirectionFlag

pc:dimension.pc:description: Indicates the end of scanline before a direction change with a value of 1 - 0 otherwise
pc:dimension.pc:name: EdgeOfFlightLine

pc:dimension.pc:description: ASPRS classification. 0 for no classification. See LAS specification for details
pc:dimension.pc:name: Classification

pc:dimension.pc:description: Angle degree at which the laster point was output from the system, including the roll of the aircraft. The scan angle is based on being nadir, and -90 the left side of the aircraft in the direction of flight
pc:dimension.pc:name: ScanAngleRank

pc:dimension.pc:description: File source ID from which the point originated. Zero indicates that the point originated in the current file
pc:dimension.pc:name: PointSourceId
